Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for the VPN Gateway, including bandwidth, latency, and redundancy needs. Identify the applications and services that will use the VPN Gateway.
Design the network architecture, including the placement of the VPN Gateway, subnet configurations, and integration with on-premises and Azure networks.
Set up a virtual network (VNet) in Azure, ensuring it has the required subnets for the VPN Gateway and other resources.
Deploy the VPN Gateway in the designated subnet of the virtual network. Choose the appropriate SKU and configuration based on requirements.
Set up the Local Network Gateway to represent the on-premises network. Define the public IP address and address space of the on-premises network.
Create and configure the VPN connection between the Azure VPN Gateway and the on-premises VPN device. Ensure proper IPsec/IKE parameters are used.
Enable encryption protocols and configure shared keys for the VPN connection. Apply Network Security Groups (NSGs) to secure the VPN Gateway subnet.
Perform connectivity tests to ensure the VPN connection is established and functioning as expected. Validate failover scenarios if applicable.
Set up monitoring and alerting for the VPN Gateway using Azure Monitor. Configure alerts for connection status, bandwidth usage, and latency.
Document the VPN Gateway setup, including network architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Share the documentation with relevant stakeholders.
Provide training to the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the VPN Gateway setup.
Ensure the VPN Gateway setup complies with organizational and regulatory requirements. Set up regular auditing procedures to verify compliance.
